head.supplied: 16/8/91 ¶ ¶ Let me thank you, dear Dr Ramsay, for the attentiveness, shown concerning the Dendrolagus, the specimen now having come back safely into my hands. I had some misgivings about Mr French's ...

div.p: ML MSS.562, Letters to E. P. Ramsay 1862-91, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p:
Let me thank you, dear Dr Ramsay, for the attentiveness, shown concerning the Dendrolagus, the specimen now having come back safely into my hands. I had some misgivings about Mr French's idea, that it was a new sp.
See M to E. Ramsay, 14 July 1891. But as you telegraphed, that the illustration in Lumholtz's work was quite exact, I could not help observing the difference of the color of the belly and the difference in the shape of the tail-end. We have beyond the few Papuan birds, sent to you for naming, only 4 others, which we have here identified with exactitude, and we have no duplicates.
See M to E Ramsay, 20 May 1891.
Let me hope, that you feel better now

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
How is our Austral Science-Nestor Dr Bennett? I never hear from him now.
George Bennett, d.1893; he had celebrated his 87th birthday on 31 January 1891.
